newsitem.title: CHINA: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mixed.
newsitem.headline: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mixed.

text.p: Following is the China Interbank Offered Rate (CHIBOR) for Monday issued by the official Xinhua news agency on behalf of the People's Bank of China, the central bank.
The figures represent weighted averages and not closing prices and are annual percentage rates.

Turnover plunged to 2.0 billion yuan from 4.6 billion yuan with most state banks and short-term financial centres, money brokerages run by the central bank, reluctant to trade with the approach of the China lunar new year on February 7.
In addition, the closure of the Shanghai and Shenzhen stock exchanges greatly reduced money demand on the interbank market, traders said.
The two exchanges closed on Monday on the lunar new year holiday and trading will not resume until February 17.
"The rates are likely to move in a narrow range in very thin trading during the lunar new year period," one trader said.
